item.title: Computing Self-Intersections, the Geometric Way
item.description:
Before we can apply ML to the triangle problem, we need to be able to compute self-intersections of a curved triangle in an accurate and hopefully efficient way so that we can generate enough training data.

The basic approach is:

  1. Subdivide the curved triangle into smaller subtriangles
  2. Find potentially intersecting pairs of subtriangles
  3. Check for actual intersections among these candidate pairs
